# Generate Random Data

```{r}
GenerateData <- function(n) {
  
  # Generate unique IDs using LETTERS
  Names <- c(LETTERS, paste0(LETTERS, LETTERS))[1:n]
  
  # Create an empty column for group assignment
  Group <- rep(NA, n)
  student_df <- data.frame(Student = Names, Group = Group, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
  student_matrix <- as.matrix(student_df)
  
  return(list(data_frame = student_df, matrix = student_matrix))
}

# Example
n_students <- 10
student_data <- GenerateData(n_students)
print(student_data$data_frame)
print(student_data$matrix)

```

# Assign Students to Groups

```{r}
MakeGroups <- function(data, num_groups) {
  
  # Take input of the number of students
  num_students <- nrow(data$data_frame)
  
  # Generate random group assignments
  group_assignments <- sample(rep(1:num_groups, length.out = num_students))
  data$data_frame$Group <- group_assignments
  data$matrix[, "Group"] <- as.character(group_assignments)
  
  return(data)
}

# Example

n_students <- 10
student_data <- GenerateData(n_students)
num_groups <- 3
grouped_data <- MakeGroups(student_data, num_groups)
print(grouped_data$data_frame)
print(grouped_data$matrix)
```
